titleInfo.title: Lia et al v. Ashford et al

name.namePart: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: Lia et al v. Ashford et al
titleInfo.subTitle: GENERAL ORDER 2007-09 concerning the management of pro se cases including supervision of pro se staff attorneys. Except for motions filed under 28 U.S.C. ยง 2255 and except for death penalty cases, Judge Kopf is assigned the overall responsibility for the management of pro se cases in the District of Nebraska and all previously filed pro se cases referred to Magistrate Judge Gossett or Magistrate Judge Thalken are herewith reassigned to Magistrate Judge Piester. The clerk's office shall file this order in each pending case referred to the Pro Se Docket in CM/ECF. Ordered by Chief Judge Bataillon. (JAE, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:07-cv-03104; Lia et al v. Ashford et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: GENERAL ORDER 2007-09 concerning the management of pro se cases including supervision of pro se staff attorneys. Except for motions filed under 28 U.S.C. ยง 2255 and except for death penalty cases, Judge Kopf is assigned the overall responsibility for the management of pro se cases in the District of Nebraska and all previously filed pro se cases referred to Magistrate Judge Gossett or Magistrate Judge Thalken are herewith reassigned to Magistrate Judge Piester. The clerk's office shall file this order in each pending case referred to the Pro Se Docket in CM/ECF. Ordered by Chief Judge Bataillon. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: Lia et al v. Ashford et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 2 Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis. Plaintiff shall pay an initial partial filing fee of $23.00 by October 19, 2007, unless an enlargement of time is granted in response to a written motion. In the absence of the initial partial filing fee by the specified deadline, this case is subject to dismissal. After payment of the initial partial filing fee, the plaintiff's institution shall collect the additional monthly payments in the manner set forth in 28 U.S.C. ยง 1915(b)(2), quoted above, and shall forward those installments to the court. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (copy mailed to Inga Hookstra, Accounting/Finance Manager, Nebraska Department of Correctional Services, Central Office Accounting, P.O. Box 94661, Lincoln, NE 68509-4661)(ADB)

titleInfo.title: Lia et al v. Ashford et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER that James Tap Lia, Nyapain Lia, Nyawai Tut, and Nyagai Lia are dismissed as plaintiffs from this action. Plaintiff Chuoljock Tap Lia remains a plaintiff in this action and remains obligated to pay the full filing fee in accordance with the court's memorandum and order granting Chuoljock Tap Lia's motion to proceed in forma pauperis. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (ADB)

titleInfo.title: Lia et al v. Ashford et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that the plaintiff shall have until December 3, 2007 to show cause why this case should not be dismissed for failure to pay the initial partial filing fee. The Clerk of the court is directed to set a pro se case management deadline in this case using the following text: December 3, 2007: show cause deadline for failure to pay initial filing fee. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (ADB)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:07-cv-03104; Lia et al v. Ashford et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER that the plaintiff shall have until December 3, 2007 to show cause why this case should not be dismissed for failure to pay the initial partial filing fee. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (ADB)

titleInfo.title: Lia et al v. Ashford et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff's Complaint is dismissed without prejudice to reassertion in accordance with this memorandum and order. The Clerk of the court is directed to send to Plaintiff the Form AO241 packet, Petition for Relief From a Conviction or Sentence By a Person in State Custody. A separate judgment will be entered in accordance with this memorandum and order. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party along with proper forms as directed)(KBJ)
